title: Job Vacancies at UPDC Plc
content:
UPDC Plc is an institutional property company founded in 1997, and listed on the NSE in 1998. UPDC Plc has a solid track record in the acquisition, development, sale and management of a diverse mix of commercial, residential, hospitality and retail assets across Nigeria. Our history is interwoven with the phenomenal growth of the Nigerian real estate sector. We are integral partners in the success of Nigeria, as we have contributed through our robust properties portfolio, to building world-class developments that have helped to shape the market whilst creating templates for other property development companies. 

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Account Reconciliation Officer
     

            
    



Job Location: CMS, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Reconciliation Officer ensures that all financial accounts, records, and statements are accurate, complete, and aligned with internal and external records.
	This role is critical for detecting discrepancies, preventing errors or fraud, and supporting the integrity of UPDC-FM’s financial reporting.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform daily, weekly, and monthly reconciliations of:
	
		Bank statements vs. company ledger
		Vendor accounts vs. internal records
		Intercompany accounts (if applicable)
	
	
	Identify and investigate discrepancies between internal records and external statements.
	Record and adjust any corrections in the ledger after proper approvals.
	Maintain detailed reconciliation files for audit and compliance purposes.
	Collaborate with Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and other departments to resolve issues.
	Prepare reconciliation reports for management review, highlighting exceptions or risks.
	Support month-end and year-end closing processes by providing reconciled account data.
	Ensure compliance with UPDC-FM’s financial policies, procedures, and internal controls.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related fields
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in account reconciliation or accounting.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles, internal controls, and financial processes.
	Proficiency in accounting software and advanced MS Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, VLOOKUP).
	Exceptional attention to detail and analytical skills.
	Strong organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills.


Competencies:


	Accuracy and thoroughness
	Analytical and investigative mindset
	Time management and ability to meet deadlines
	Integrity and confidentiality.


Application Closing Date: 3rd March, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: snwaneri@updcfm.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Estate Accountant

Job Location: Marina, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Maintaining accurate financial records, including budgets, service charge accounts, and financial reports.
	Monitoring expenses to ensure adherence to approved budgets and cost controls.
	Preparing monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements for management review.
	Providing financial analysis to support operational and strategic decisions.
	Ensuring compliance with financial regulations and company policies.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in accounting, preferably within the facilities management sector.
	Proficiency in accounting software and advanced Excel skills.
	Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skill
	Professionally certified.


Application Closing Date: 17th February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Facility Manager

Job Location: Lagos Island (Marina), Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are a leading Facilities Management company committed to delivering excellent Facility management services.
	We seek a dynamic and results-driven Facility Manager to join our team and ensure smooth operations in our sites.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee the daily operations of facilities, ensuring compliance with health, safety, and environmental standards.
	Manage building maintenance, repairs, and renovations.
	Develop and implement cost-effective maintenance strategies.
	Prepare and manage budgets, monitor expenses, and ensure cost optimization.
	Conduct routine inspections to ensure facilities meet organizational and legal standards.
	Supervise and support facility staff to ensure operational excellence.


Salary
N300,000 - N500,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 16th March, 2026.

Click here to apply online

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content &amp; Creative Specialist&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Benin City, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

Role Overview


	We are looking for a talented and imaginative Content &amp; Creative Specialist to join our team onsite in Benin City.
	This role is ideal for a creative professional who blends visual storytelling, design skills, and digital content creation.
	You will play a key role in shaping how Nigeria Markt looks, feels, and communicates across digital platforms and marketing campaigns.


Key Responsibilities
Primary Focus:
Video Editing &amp; Motion Content:


	Create engaging short-form videos and motion graphics for social media and campaigns
	Edit video content for promotions, product highlights, and brand storytelling
	Add captions, transitions, and visual effects that align with brand style


Graphics Design:


	Design compelling visuals for digital campaigns, ads, and social media
	Create banners, flyers, promotional creatives, and branded materials
	Ensure all designs are visually consistent with Nigeria Markt&rsquo;s brand identity


Content Creation:


	Develop creative content tailored for social media, paid ads, and promotional campaigns
	Write engaging captions, headlines, and short marketing copy
	Contribute ideas for trends, themes, and campaign concepts


Secondary Support:
Social Content Scheduling:


	Assist in preparing and scheduling content for timely publishing across platforms
	Help maintain a consistent posting calendar


Campaign Execution:


	Support the marketing team during different campaign phases
	Adapt creatives for different platforms and audiences
	Help ensure campaigns are delivered on time with all required assets

	Proven experience in content creation, graphic design, or digital media
	Strong skills in design tools (Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or similar)
	Experience with video editing tools (CapCut, Premiere Pro, After Effects, or similar)
	Good understanding of social media trends and content formats
	Strong creativity and attention to visual detail
	Basic copywriting ability for social and promotional content
	Ability to work both independently and as part of a team
	Must be based in Benin City and available to work onsite


Nice to Have:


	Experience creating content for a startup, marketplace, or e-commerce brand
	Knowledge of motion graphics or animated text effects
	Understanding of paid ad creatives and performance-focused content.

	A creative, collaborative, and fast-paced environment
	Career growth opportunities as Nigeria Markt expands
	Competitive salary based on experience.
